sen.j: 伊藤忠兵衛 （いとう ちゅうべえ、天保13年7月2日 (旧暦)（1842年8月7日） - 1903年（明治36年）7月8日）は日本の商人､実業家。
sen.e: Chubei ITO (August 7, 1842 - July 8, 1903) was a Japanese merchant and businessman.
Chubei ITO (August 7, 1842 - July 8, 1903) was a Japanese merchant and businessman.
Chubei ITO (August 7, 1842 - July 8, 1903) was a Japanese merchant and businessman.

sen.j: 伊藤忠商事・丸紅という2つの大手商社を創業し、多角的経営によって伊藤忠財閥を形成した。
sen.e: He founded two big trading companies such as ITOCHU Corporation and Marubeni Corporation, and formed the Itochu Zaibatsu (company syndicate) by a diversified management.
He founded two big trading companies such as ITOCHU Corporation and Marubeni Corporation, and formed the Itochu Zaibatsu (conglomerate) by diversification.

sen.j: 実家は「紅長」（べんちょう）の屋号で繊維小売業を営んでいた。
sen.e: His family was a fiber retailer which store's name was 'Bencho'.

sen.j: 伊藤家は、兄の伊藤長兵衛と弟の忠兵衛が、1858年、近江麻布類行商をなしたのにはじまる。
sen.e: The ITO Family started as a peddler of Omi hemp begun by Chubei and his elder brother Chobei ITO in 1858.
The Ito family as a merchant started to grow since Chubei and his older brother Chobei ITO began travel peddling of Omi linen in 1858.

sen.e: The Ito family as a merchant started to grow since Chubei and his older brother Chobei ITO began travel peddling of Omi linen in 1858.

sen.j: 伊藤忠・丸紅とも、この年をもって創業としている。
sen.e: ITOCHU Corporation and Marubeni Corporation were officially founded in this year.
ITOCHU Corporation and Marubeni Corporation officially call this year to be the year of the foundations.

sen.j: 初代忠兵衛は天保13年7月2日に五代伊藤長兵衛の次男として生まれ、生家は「紅長」（べんちょう）の屋号で、耳付物という繊維品の小売をなし、また一、二町の田地を自作する手作りの地主でもあった。
sen.e: Chubei I was born as the second-born son of Chobei ITO V into the family running a fiber retailer mainly dealing with the processed fiber called Mimitsukimono under the store name of Bencho, and his family was also a landlord of a 1-to-2-cho-wide rice field privately owned and cultivated by themselves.
sen.cmt: 「耳付物」については詳細不明。和暦を西暦に変更しました。
sen.e: On August 7, 1842, Chubei (the first) was born as the second son of Chobei ITO (the fifth); his family had been running a store 'Bencho' that had been selling some fabrics and products called 'mimitsuki-mono'; they were also a landowner of a large field including fields of 9,918 – 19,836 square meters for their own.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ、訳語選択ミスがあります。

sen.j: 近江湖東の犬上郡甲良郷八目村（犬上郡豊郷町八目）で安政5年5月に持下り業を開業した。
sen.e: He started a business of peddling in May, 1858 at Hachime-mura, Kawara-go, Inukami-gun in the east of Omi Lake (present Hachime, Toyosato-cho, Inukami-gun).
He started a business of peddling in May, 1858 at Hachime-mura, Kawara-go, Inukami County in the east of Omi Lake (present Hachime, Toyosato-cho, Inukami County).

sen.j: 堺・紀州に行商した。
sen.e: They peddled to Sakai and Kishu.

sen.j: 兄の長兵衛は国元で仕入れに当たり、のち博多新川端にて「伊藤長兵衛商店」を開業した。
sen.e: His elder brother Chobei took on the stock purchase at the local level of domain, and later opened 'Ito Chobei's Store' at Shin-Kawabata, Hakata.
His older brother Chobei took charge of buying in their hometown and later opened 'Ito Chobei Shoten' (Ito Chobei's Store) at Shin-Kawabata, Hakata.

sen.j: 弟忠兵衛は明治5年１月に大阪本町二丁目に呉服、太物店をはじめ「紅忠」（べんちゅう）と称し、麻布類、尾濃織物、関東織物を取り扱う。
sen.e: Chubei opened a store retailing draperies and Futomono (cotton or hemp cloth) under the store name of 'Benchu' at 2 chome, Honcho, Osaka in January, 1872, and dealt with hemp, Bino textile and Kanto textile.

sen.e: In January, 1872, Chubei also opened a drapery shop of silk, cotton and linen 'Benchu' at 2 chome, Honcho, Osaka, and dealt with linen, Bino textile and Kanto textile.

sen.j: この2つが合併・分割を繰り返して現在の伊藤忠・丸紅につながっている。
sen.e: These two stores repeated merger and partition to form present ITOCHU and Marubeni.
These two stores repeated merger and division to form present ITOCHU and Marubeni.

sen.j: 「紅忠」は開店と同時に店法を定め、利益三分主義をとり、店の純利益は本家納め、本店積立金と店員配当に分かち、五、三、二の配分率で「三つ割銀」といわれた。
sen.e: Upon Benchu's open, he established a store law and employed Rieki-sanbun-shugi (a financial system dividing profits to three categories) to allot the 50% to his family, 30% to reserve fund of the main store and 20% to employee's salary, and it was called 'Mitsuwarigin'.

Upon Benichu's open, he established a store law and employed Rieki-sanbun-shugi (a financial system dividing profits to three categories) to allot the 50% of the net profit to his family, 30% to reserve fund of the main store and 20% to employee's salary, and it was called 'Mitsuwarigin.'

Upon Benichu's open, he established a store law and employed Rieki-sanbun-shugi (a financial system dividing profits to three categories) to allot the 50% of the net profit to his family, 30% to reserve fund of the main store and 20% to employee's salary, and it was called 'Mitsuwarigin.'

sen.j: 店員への配当によって勤労意欲を喚起し、これは伝統的な近江商法に属する。
sen.e: The dividend to the employees raised their motivation, which belonged to a traditional Omi management.
Such dividend to the employees enhanced their motivation to work, which was the method of management that had been traditionally applied by Omi merchants.

sen.j: 真宗の信仰に厚く、「商売は苦薩の業」と説き、多数の人材を育て、産を分かつことを商売繁盛の本道としていた。
sen.e: He was a devout believer in Shinshu sect, and believed that key to prosperous trade was in development of human resources and profit sharing, saying 'Business is Kusatsu's work'.

He was a devout believer in the Shin sect, and always said that 'business is Kusatsu's work' ('Kusatsu' was the parody of 'Bosatsu' [Bodhisattva]; he meant that business was not an original work Bodhisattva had to engage); and he believed that the key to the prosperity was in development of people's talents and sharing the profits.

sen.j: 明治18年、甥の外海鉄治郎と組合組織で「伊藤外海組」をはじめ、神戸に事務所をおいて、直貿易を始める。
sen.e: In 1885, he founded 'Ito Tonogai Gumi' in form of associative organisation along with his cousin Tetsujiro TONOGAI, and began a direct trade at a newly set office in Kobe.

sen.e: In 1893, a cotton thread retailer 'Ito's Thread Store' was opened at 2 chome, Azuchi, to start dealing with cotton thread, too.

sen.j: 29年には「日東合資会社」をつくり、中国綿の輸入と日本綿糸の輸出にあたる。
sen.e: In 1896, he founded 'Nitto Limited Partnership' to begin import of Chinese cotton and export of Japanese cotton.

sen.e: On July 8, 1903, Chubei I passed away at his second residence in Suma district.
